You know, the good looking one that’s great at sport and gets all the girls. The Parisian-inspired brand is a one-stop shop for staples, offering a plethora of options from sweaters and shirts to shoes and socks. They have it all, and they do it well. Very well. Keep reading as I pull together 10 essential Octobre Éditions styles that’ll improve your wardrobe and ready you for the seasons (and years) ahead. Key Takeaways Creating a well-rounded wardrobe is the best way to ensure you always have something to wear. By investing in luxury basics, like an Oxford shirt and straight-leg jeans, you can strengthen your sartorial prowess and create adaptable outfits that’ll never fall out of favor. Thanks to Octobre, you don’t have to look far to find such versatility. Here, I’ve rounded up a list of everyday essentials, some of which you’ll want to invest in right away. You can, of course, buy them all. Who am I to stop you? In This ArticleOur FavoritesReasons We Love OctobreFinal Word View More on Octobre Éditions Best Shirt: Oxford Charlie Shirt Versatile, timeless, and effortlessly cool, the button-down Oxford is a key component of the male wardrobe. Favored by all your favorite fashionable fellas, from Paul Newman to Steve McQueen, the plain white version is iconic. Wear Octobre’s with everything from sneakers and khakis to loafers and jeans. Or layer it underneath a sweater or cardigan once the chillier evenings arrive. Best Pants: Young Trousers More casual than dress pants but smarter than chinos, the Young trousers have found a rather dashing middle ground. They’re made from a beautifully light Japanese cotton fabric with double pleats and turn-ups. You can choose to dress them up with a crew neck tee, blazer, and smart sneakers, or keep it chill with hiking boots and chunky knitwear. Best Coat: Hopper Trench Coat Polished, practical, and pretty much perfect, the trench coat is a must-have for those in-between months, lending a stylish helping hand when the weather begins to turn. The Hopper is Octobre’s take, designed to keep you dry and your style on point. Easy to dress up or down, it’ll soon become your outerwear go-to. Wear it with everything from hoodies and sweatpants to shirts and chinos. Best Jeans: Kurt Straight Jeans If you hadn’t noticed, jeans are getting baggier—skinny styles are no more. Trouble is, there’s no telling for how long. What we do know is, straight-legged denim isn’t going anywhere (and it never has, or will). This pair from Octobre Éditions boasts a versatile blue wash, that’ll age gracefully, in a classic five-pocket design. You can wear them with your favorite flannel shirt or keep it uber-casual with a hoodie and high-tops. Best Accessory: Leon Socks Often an afterthought, socks are the silent wardrobe hero. Not only do they keep your feet warm or create a barrier against blisters, they finish your look with the kind of panache only the very best dressed men can claim. This pair has been knitted in Octobre’s French atelier from a cotton-blend fabric that’s soft, breathable, and slightly stretchy. They’re finished with two stripes and ribbed tops that ensure they remain in place throughout the day. Best Jacket: Will Jacket Inspired by classic workwear overalls, this hardworking jacket is the perfect layering piece. In the milder months you can throw it over a lightweight tee, while it’ll slot perfectly under a bigger coat when it’s cold. My favorite feature is the large front pockets (there’s two) that offer a comfy place to rest your hands, plus essentials like your cell, keys, and wallet. Best Polo: Moreno Sweater The Moreno is a soft wool design that manages to perfectly bridge the gap between smart and casual. Undefeated when it comes to off-duty cool, it’s warmer than your average polo and considerably more stylish too. I love the subtle rib cuffs, just long enough to be a noticeable addition and how it can lend itself to a variety of looks—from semi-formal fits to relaxed everyday attire. I’ll be wearing mine with loose-fitting pants and a pair of adidas Spezial sneakers. Best T-Shirt: Kenneth T-Shirt A wardrobe mainstay and the perfect foundational piece, the plain white tee has long been the go-to base layer for some of the world’s most stylish men—from James Dean and Alain Delon to David Beckham and Jacob Elrodi. Which is why it’s never a bad idea to invest in another. Crafted from a weighty cotton fabric in an impeccable cut, this one provides endless styling opportunities; it can be layered underneath a shirt or jacket, or you might want to wear it alone with some jeans or shorts. You could even get away with teaming it with casual tailoring and penny loafers. Best Jumper: Nils Sweater A breathable, yet warm jumper is just what the doctor ordered. Come the cool breezy fall evenings, whether you’re dining alfresco or taking a late-night stroll along the tree-lined streets. Octobre Éditions version is made from merino wool, allowing you to benefit from the cooling properties while avoiding bulk and getting too sweaty. You can wear it alone with jeans or casual pants or layer it underneath a blazer once the temperature starts to drop even more. Best Shoes: Woody Chelsea Boots Few shoes are as reliable as the Chelsea boot. Smart, sturdy, and stylish, it’s an excellent all-rounder that looks just as good with a suit as it does with a polo shirt and jeans. An essential for chillier, winter weather, but just as good for the milder months, the Woody is made from smooth leather that’ll soften and gain character over time. The leather soles are equally as impressive, complete with protective rubber pads that add to the durability and help keep your feet firmly on the ground. View More on Octobre Éditions Three Reasons We Love Octobre Sustainable Turns out the brand is big on sustainability. 60% of the materials used in the latest collection are eco-friendly, shipping boxes are made from recycled cardboard, and every single one of its ateliers are audited at least once a year to check on working conditions. After Care Head to the Tips & Maintenance section of the website and you’ll find a bunch of handy hacks to keep your Octobre Éditions purchases in top condition. Amongst many others, there’s an article on how to get rid of stains, plus a full guide on ironing. Timeless Forget fleeting trends, Octobre’s pieces can be worn season after season. From sweaters to polo shirts, each design has been made with longevity in mind—which is better for your wallet and the planet. View More on Octobre Éditions Final Word It’s never too late to start creating a capsule wardrobe. Sure, it takes a little time and patience, but with Octobre Éditions onside you’ll be turning up the timelessness in a matter of months. If you ask me, I’d suggest starting with the Oxford Charlie shirt, Will jacket, and Kenneth tee—they can all be worn together and teamed with pretty much anything else currently in your closet. Octobre is a bit like the guy at college that could do everything. You know, the good looking one that’s great at sport and gets all the girls.

The Parisian-inspired brand is a one-stop shop for staples, offering a plethora of options from sweaters and shirts to shoes and socks. They have it all, and they do it well. Very well.

Keep reading as I pull together 10 essential Octobre Éditions styles that’ll improve your wardrobe and ready you for the seasons (and years) ahead.

Key Takeaways

Creating a well-rounded wardrobe is the best way to ensure you always have something to wear. By investing in luxury basics, like an Oxford shirt and straight-leg jeans, you can strengthen your sartorial prowess and create adaptable outfits that’ll never fall out of favor.

Thanks to Octobre, you don’t have to look far to find such versatility. Here, I’ve rounded up a list of everyday essentials, some of which you’ll want to invest in right away. You can, of course, buy them all. Who am I to stop you?


In This Article

  1. Our Favorites
  2. Reasons We Love Octobre
  3. Final Word

Best Shirt: Oxford Charlie Shirt

Versatile, timeless, and effortlessly cool, the button-down Oxford is a key component of the male wardrobe. Favored by all your favorite fashionable fellas, from Paul Newman to Steve McQueen, the plain white version is iconic.

Wear Octobre’s with everything from sneakers and khakis to loafers and jeans. Or layer it underneath a sweater or cardigan once the chillier evenings arrive.

Best Pants: Young Trousers

More casual than dress pants but smarter than chinos, the Young trousers have found a rather dashing middle ground. They’re made from a beautifully light Japanese cotton fabric with double pleats and turn-ups.

You can choose to dress them up with a crew neck tee, blazer, and smart sneakers, or keep it chill with hiking boots and chunky knitwear.

Best Coat: Hopper Trench Coat

Polished, practical, and pretty much perfect, the trench coat is a must-have for those in-between months, lending a stylish helping hand when the weather begins to turn. The Hopper is Octobre’s take, designed to keep you dry and your style on point.

Easy to dress up or down, it’ll soon become your outerwear go-to. Wear it with everything from hoodies and sweatpants to shirts and chinos.

Best Jeans: Kurt Straight Jeans

If you hadn’t noticed, jeans are getting baggier—skinny styles are no more. Trouble is, there’s no telling for how long. What we do know is, straight-legged denim isn’t going anywhere (and it never has, or will).

This pair from Octobre Éditions boasts a versatile blue wash, that’ll age gracefully, in a classic five-pocket design. You can wear them with your favorite flannel shirt or keep it uber-casual with a hoodie and high-tops.

Best Accessory: Leon Socks

Often an afterthought, socks are the silent wardrobe hero. Not only do they keep your feet warm or create a barrier against blisters, they finish your look with the kind of panache only the very best dressed men can claim.

This pair has been knitted in Octobre’s French atelier from a cotton-blend fabric that’s soft, breathable, and slightly stretchy. They’re finished with two stripes and ribbed tops that ensure they remain in place throughout the day.

Best Jacket: Will Jacket

Inspired by classic workwear overalls, this hardworking jacket is the perfect layering piece. In the milder months you can throw it over a lightweight tee, while it’ll slot perfectly under a bigger coat when it’s cold.

My favorite feature is the large front pockets (there’s two) that offer a comfy place to rest your hands, plus essentials like your cell, keys, and wallet.

Best Polo: Moreno Sweater

The Moreno is a soft wool design that manages to perfectly bridge the gap between smart and casual. Undefeated when it comes to off-duty cool, it’s warmer than your average polo and considerably more stylish too.

I love the subtle rib cuffs, just long enough to be a noticeable addition and how it can lend itself to a variety of looks—from semi-formal fits to relaxed everyday attire. I’ll be wearing mine with loose-fitting pants and a pair of adidas Spezial sneakers.

Best T-Shirt: Kenneth T-Shirt

A wardrobe mainstay and the perfect foundational piece, the plain white tee has long been the go-to base layer for some of the world’s most stylish men—from James Dean and Alain Delon to David Beckham and Jacob Elrodi. Which is why it’s never a bad idea to invest in another.

Crafted from a weighty cotton fabric in an impeccable cut, this one provides endless styling opportunities; it can be layered underneath a shirt or jacket, or you might want to wear it alone with some jeans or shorts. You could even get away with teaming it with casual tailoring and penny loafers.

Best Jumper: Nils Sweater

A breathable, yet warm jumper is just what the doctor ordered. Come the cool breezy fall evenings, whether you’re dining alfresco or taking a late-night stroll along the tree-lined streets.

Octobre Éditions version is made from merino wool, allowing you to benefit from the cooling properties while avoiding bulk and getting too sweaty. You can wear it alone with jeans or casual pants or layer it underneath a blazer once the temperature starts to drop even more.

Best Shoes: Woody Chelsea Boots

Few shoes are as reliable as the Chelsea boot. Smart, sturdy, and stylish, it’s an excellent all-rounder that looks just as good with a suit as it does with a polo shirt and jeans.

An essential for chillier, winter weather, but just as good for the milder months, the Woody is made from smooth leather that’ll soften and gain character over time. The leather soles are equally as impressive, complete with protective rubber pads that add to the durability and help keep your feet firmly on the ground.

Three Reasons We Love Octobre

Sustainable

Turns out the brand is big on sustainability. 60% of the materials used in the latest collection are eco-friendly, shipping boxes are made from recycled cardboard, and every single one of its ateliers are audited at least once a year to check on working conditions.

After Care

Head to the Tips & Maintenance section of the website and you’ll find a bunch of handy hacks to keep your Octobre Éditions purchases in top condition. Amongst many others, there’s an article on how to get rid of stains, plus a full guide on ironing.

Timeless

Forget fleeting trends, Octobre’s pieces can be worn season after season. From sweaters to polo shirts, each design has been made with longevity in mind—which is better for your wallet and the planet.

Final Word

It’s never too late to start creating a capsule wardrobe. Sure, it takes a little time and patience, but with Octobre Éditions onside you’ll be turning up the timelessness in a matter of months.

If you ask me, I’d suggest starting with the Oxford Charlie shirt, Will jacket, and Kenneth tee—they can all be worn together and teamed with pretty much anything else currently in your closet.

Billy is a content specialist and social media manager. His portfolio includes articles for publications such as British GQ, Esquire and Men’s Health. A self-confessed lover of luxury streetwear, he admits to an unhealthy obsession for baseball caps and high-end sneakers.
